intro: Phylica nuda, commonly known as the naked phylica, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Proteaceae and is characterized by its simple, leafless stems and clusters of small, white or pale yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in sandy or rocky soils and is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments. Its flowers attract pollinators such as bees and birds, contributing to its ecological role in its native habitat. Phylica nuda is often used in horticulture for its ornamental value and drought tolerance.
